channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Banksy stab-proof vest made famous by British rapper Stormzy sold for £780,000
item.description: "In a way only Banksy can, he manages to powerfully condense a complex social issue through one redolent object."

item.title: A Former Whistle-Blower Under Trump on What’s at Risk for Public Health
item.description: The future of America’s public health agencies looks bleak under Trump.

item.title: Nima Rinji Sherpa Becomes Youngest Climber to Summit 14 Highest Mountains
item.description: Nima Rinji Sherpa’s achievement highlights the role of Sherpas in an activity where they shoulder much of the risk but receive little glory.

item.title: China markets follow U.S. rise with lift from new Beijing stimulus optimism
item.description: Traders around the word awaited U.S. inflation data for September—and the implications it will have for rate cuts at the Federal Reserve's November me...

item.title: Supreme Court Reform Is in the Air
item.description: Say no to court packing — and yes to term limits.

item.title: Billionaire Mark Cuban once ran a Ponzi scheme to pay for his college tuition
item.description: Before Cuban was worth nearly $8 billion, he ran a scam from his dorm room.

item.title: Near-miss at Nashville airport after two planes were cleared to use the same runway
item.description: Pilots of the Alaska plane aborted their Sept. 12 takeoff at Nashville International Airport, applying the brakes so hard that the tires deflated.

item.title: Neither Trump Nor Harris Can Bring Back the Good Old Days of Manufacturing
item.description: If manufacturing returns, it will look nothing like the renaissance being promised by Harris and Trump.

item.title: Rubble, and Defiance
item.description: Once lively and densely packed, the area on the edges of Beirut that was hit by an Israeli strike is now vacant.

item.title: British pharma giant GSK strikes $2.3 billion deal to put an end to 80,000 U.S. lawsuits
item.description: GSK has agreed to pay $2.3 billion to put an end to lawsuits alleging that its Zantac heartburn drug caused cancer.

item.title: Nima Rinji Sherpa Becomes Youngest Climber to Summit 14 Highest Mountains
item.description: Nima Rinji Sherpa’s achievement highlights the role of Sherpas in an activity where they shoulder much of the risk but receive little glory.

item.title: While N.B.A. Plays in Abu Dhabi, Critics Cry Foul
item.description: The league has held preseason games in the United Arab Emirates for three years. It says its impact has been positive, but others say it’s helping a r...

item.title: I Study Political Violence. I’m Worried About the Election.
item.description: Our officials and our ballots may be in physical danger.

item.title: Black Girls Hike Founder Seeks to Make U.K. Hiking More Inclusive
item.description: Motivated by the racial disparity she saw on trails, Rhiane Fatinikun founded Black Girls Hike to make Britain’s countryside more inclusive.

item.title: Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary Gets a Hostile Serenade in Strasbourg
item.description: Some progressive members sang “Bella Ciao,” a song associated with antifascism, to show opposition to Prime Minister Viktor Orban, who’s been accused ...
